audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear optimization of existing diagnostic screening function. AI tool improves accuracy of chest X-ray interpretation, a standard medical process. Pattern is replicable across healthcare systems.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization (AstraZeneca), specific quantified metric (54.1% PPV vs 20% threshold), traceable to named study (CREATE) and conference presentation. Highly credible.
audited_claims.notes: Strong Tier 1 case - optimizes diagnostic accuracy in established screening process with clear performance metrics

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Demonstrates scale deployment of screening optimization. Large-scale implementation (660k+ people) shows operational efficiency in existing healthcare delivery. Replicable pattern for population health screening.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific scale metrics (660,000 people, 8% detection rate), named geography (Thailand), timeframe specified (since 2022). Credible operational data.

apqc_functions.name: Plan and manage customer service contacts

audited_claims.notes: Excellent evidence of scaled operational deployment with clear volume metrics

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Infrastructure scaling of proven capability optimization. Expanding AI screening across hospital network represents systematic efficiency improvement in healthcare delivery.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific implementation details (887 hospitals, 415M baht budget, 3-year timeline), named implementing organization (Thailand's National Health Security Office). Authoritative source.
audited_claims.notes: Strong evidence of systematic capability deployment with clear resource allocation

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear process optimization in clinical trial documentation. 85% time reduction in document authoring represents significant efficiency gain in established R&D workflow. Highly replicable pattern.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization, specific quantified improvement (85% time reduction), clear process description (document authoring). Credible efficiency claim.
audited_claims.notes: Excellent Tier 1 case - dramatic efficiency improvement in bounded process with clear metric

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Optimization of drug discovery success rates. Improving Phase I success from 40-65% to 80-90% represents significant efficiency gain in established R&D process. Pattern applicable across pharmaceutical industry.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization, specific quantified metrics with clear benchmark comparison (80-90% vs 40-65%), established industry context. Credible performance claim.
audited_claims.notes: Strong capability optimization with clear risk reduction and efficiency metrics in R&D process

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Appears to optimize clinical trial patient recruitment efficiency. StudyTeam tool improving patient randomization rates represents process optimization, but lacks specificity.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization and tool (StudyTeam), but metrics are vague ('more patients per site per month' without quantification). Positive feedback mentioned but not detailed.
audited_claims.notes: Clear optimization pattern but lacks specific metrics. Needs quantified improvement data for full approval.

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Strong indicator of process optimization effectiveness. 100% retention rate for StudyTeam usage suggests significant operational improvement in clinical trial management. Replicable pattern.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization and tool, specific metric (100% continuation rate), clear behavioral indicator of value. Credible retention metric.
audited_claims.notes: Strong retention metric indicates significant process improvement value, though underlying efficiency gains not quantified

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: This describes strategic goals and business model transformation rather than specific process optimization. '20 new medicines by 2030' represents business strategy, not functional efficiency improvement.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: While organization is named and goal is specific, this is a strategic objective rather than an operational capability improvement with measurable efficiency gains.
audited_claims.notes: Strategic goal rather than capability optimization. Lacks specific process improvement metrics. May be better suited for tier 1 classification.

tier_verification: Correctly classified as tier 1. Most claims describe optimization of existing pharmaceutical R&D and healthcare delivery processes with clear efficiency improvements. C8 is strategic rather than operational and should be rejected for tier 1.
